title: r/askthedonald is a racist, transphobic ban evasion sub.

author: Immaloner
text: And they will ban you just as quick as T_D. I naively thought it was an actual sub for asking questions. I asked some really innocuous question and within 5 minutes banned for "trolling."

author: tehreal
text: The better version of the sub is /r/AskTrumpSupporters

author: AnotherPersonPerhaps
text:
That place is a complete disaster in my opinion.

At first it seemed kinda okayish, until they implemented the rules about non-supporters having to phrase everything as a question....which just turned into a dumpster fire in my opinion. Everyone is just trying to find the least awkward way of debating while also finding a way to make it a question. It's like a round of Jeopardy gone horribly wrong.

Their reasoning for it was laughable. They framed it as "this is a Q&A sub not a debate sub" as if their userbase has anything interesting to say at all that we haven't heard a million times over again.

This is every post on that sub. "Hey Trump did this crazy ass thing how does that make you feel (subtext: do you not yet realize how shitty he is?)" followed by "Well yeah that might have been kinda dumb but really its fine because we don't really care about anything" and then a few people that just support whatever dumb shit he did without question.

There's nothing I'm going to learn about Trump supporters from asking Trump supporters how they feel about Trump. They aren't all that thoughtful about it and don't have anything really significant to say, especially that sub's users.

It's a complete waste of effort and I view it as a bad faith effort on their part  due to the fact that they don't allow proper discussion.
